title: [GAMEPLAY] Demolish can damage turrets while Tower Invulnerability is toggled on in Practice Tool
body:
The Demolish rune can damage turrets even while Tower Invulnerability is turned on in Practice Tool. To reproduce, simply use Demolish on a turret in Practice Tool while Tower Invulnerability is turned on. A bot opponent can do this as well.

This bug has been reported before but is still live, so I'm starting a new thread rather than necroing an existing one.

replies.body: That's probably intended. it's the only way to have it so you can tell how much damage Demolish is doing without your auto's damage being included.

> [{quoted}](name=DeceasedL0ved0ne,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=Qfme79eI,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2019-02-03T20:23:32.893+0000)
>
> That's probably intended. it's the only way to have it so you can tell how much damage Demolish is doing without your auto's damage being included.

That's a pretty niche case to justify the interference when a bot does it, though. Given that it's not documented anywhere and the whole purpose of that toggle is to prevent towers from being destroyed when you don't want them to be, I still suspect it's a bug.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=Qfme79eI,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-02-03T20:32:17.746+0000)
>
> That's a pretty niche case to justify the interference when a bot does it, though. Given that it's not documented anywhere and the whole purpose of that toggle is to prevent towers from being destroyed when you don't want them to be, I still suspect it's a bug.

Where does it say the whole purpose is to prevent towers from being destroyed? Checking the damage of a tower-only rune makes sense, too. 

It's way more niche that you'd have a bot in the game _and_ not want towers destroyed, _and_ not be killing the bot, _and_ that it's even a bot with Demolish.

> [{quoted}](name=DeceasedL0ved0ne,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=Qfme79eI,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-03T20:55:09.058+0000)
>
> Where does it say the whole purpose is to prevent towers from being destroyed? Checking the damage of a tower-only rune makes sense, too. 
> 
> It's way more niche that you'd have a bot in the game _and_ not want towers destroyed, _and_ not be killing the bot, _and_ that it's even a bot with Demolish.

The toggle is named "Toggle Towers Invincible" but the towers are not invincible. I think that's a bug.

I'm not going to argue with you about what people want to do, but you can check the damage contribution from Demolish by hitting a tower normally and then with Demolish, and then doing some subtraction. It's not nearly as easy to allow a tanky bot to gain exp/gold without taking down turrets.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=Qfme79eI,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-02-04T00:06:49.514+0000)
>
> The toggle is named "Toggle Towers Invincible" but the towers are not invincible. I think that's a bug.
> 
> I'm not going to argue with you about what people want to do, but you can check the damage contribution from Demolish by hitting a tower normally and then with Demolish, and then doing some subtraction. It's not nearly as easy to allow a tanky bot to gain exp/gold without taking down turrets.

You can think it's a bug all you want. I'm telling you it's probably a feature. 

If anything, the fact we can't set dummies as champions with a specific level and items is the real bug here.
